domain.comment: domain (with protocol) in which the app is hosted (without the trailing slash)

facebook_api_key.comment: Graph API key to access Facebook. This can be obtained from http://developers.facebook.com => Apps => Your App => App ID. If you are creating the app for the first time, add {{domain}} to the list of App Domains.

flickr_api_key.comment: Flickr App Garden API key. This can be obtained from https://www.flickr.com/services/ => Apps by you => Your App's Key. If you are creating the app for the first time, set the callback URL to http://{{domain}}/callbacks/flickr.php

flickr_api_secret.comment: Flickr App Garden API secret. This can be obtained from https://www.flickr.com/services/ => Apps by you => Your App's Secret

google_api_key.comment: Google API key to access Google+. This can be obtained from https://console.developers.google.com => Your App => APIs & Auth => Credentials => Client ID. If you are creating the app for the first time, add {{domain}} to Javascript Origins and http://{{domain}}/callbacks/google.php to Redirect URIs. Under APIs & Auth => API => Enable Google+ API and Contacts API.

google_api_secret.comment: Google API key to access Google+. This can be obtained from https://console.developers.google.com => Your App => APIs & Auth => Credentials => Client Secret

instagram_api_key.comment: Instagram API key. This can be obtained from http://instagram.com/developer => Manage Clients => Your App => Client ID. If you are creating the app for the first time, specify {{domain}} as Website URL and {{domain}}/callbacks/instagram.php as Redirect URI.

instagram_api_secret.comment: Instagram API key. This can be obtained from http://instagram.com/developer => Manage Clients => Your App => Client Secret.

log.comment: If set to 'true', API calls will be logged in a Postgres database. Connection string field is required if set to true.
